website_summaries.verdict: This freeze-dried beef liver treat is a good choice for pets with allergies, and we love the resealable bin that they come in.
pros: Made in the USA from 100% pure beef liver
Contains no grains, gluten, hormones, or other additives
Good for dogs with food allergies
cons: The quality is a bit inconsistent, tub to tub
some are good, others look different or smell bad
Reports that these break down quite a bit in transit

customer_reviews.title: WHAT THE XXXX!!
customer_reviews.text: I just opened these, which I have purchased for years. Just wanted others to see how much was in this can (see pictures). I realize there will be some settlement of the product but in no way is this 12 ounces. I am returning this batch. This is UNACCEPTABLE for the amount they are charging for these things. I’m furious.
customer_reviews.author: Jude

customer_reviews.title: Used to buy NO MORE- BUGS inProduct
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing this item for quite some time however the most recent batch I have I realized that the treats had odd holes in them I looked a little bit more and realize there and there were live bugs crawling around in the box!! so upset that I have been feeding these to my dogs and now I know why my dogs were sick last week and had to go to the vet for diarrhea.
customer_reviews.author: Lulu Salerno

customer_reviews.title: $35.00 for this?!
customer_reviews.text: My cats are spoiled. They get HDP freeze-dried chicken breasts and bonito flakes every day as a treat. My husband and I decided to try the 14.8 oz. size of Stewart treats for a change of pace--what a mistake! I've attached a picture of what is in the bucket: one of the reasons we bought in a plastic bucket was to ensure the pieces would remain intact, no be crushed or in little pieces. Not the case with Stewart. The pieces are extremely hard, small, some very sharp, with about 1/3 crumbs in the bucket. A complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: SaraTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: UGGGGHHHH!!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't review products too often -- usually only if they're the greatest thing since sliced bread or the worst thing since the Marquis de Sade. This product falls into the latter category. The smell of these treats was HORRIBLE! Two of my three dogs turned up their noses, and the third one actually backed away as if I were offering her a deadly scorpion to munch on. Unh-uh, never again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: ... ordered these treats dozens of times and been very happy with the product
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered these treats dozens of times and been very happy with the product, as my bulldog absolutely loves them. However, the past several times I've ordered, the treats are no longer chunk you squares but rather tiny slivers. The last container was essentially just crumbs. Now this used to be the case when you got down to the bottom of the container, which is more acceptable than having an entire container of crumbs. I'm going to give them one more try and then I'm moving on to a new brand. It's a great product, I wish there was better quality control and cosistency.
customer_reviews.author: M and M

customer_reviews.title: My dogs got sick
customer_reviews.text: Within an hour after giving my dogs 1 of these freeze dried treats, 3 of my dogs threw up, including my papillon with the cast iron stomach. It was the first time I had ever seen my 10-year-old dog throw up. I feel there must be something very wrong with these treats and I will not be feeding them again.
customer_reviews.author: KIM PETERS

customer_reviews.title: Product has changed - stay away
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased the Turkey Liver dog treats several times previously over the past 2 years. Originally, we were very satisfied with the product. We re-ordered on October 18 and received a product that was MARKEDLY inferior to what we had been sent previously. It was darker, non-uniformly colored, smelled terrible, and occupied a fraction of the container (maybe 50%). Amazon sent us a replacement which was identical to the inferior one we had just received. Amazon refunded our money and we have written the manufacturer. I would advise everyone to stay away from this product.
customer_reviews.author: E. Frigo

customer_reviews.title: Stewart Freeze Dried Chicken Breast Treats by Pro-Treat-Rancid Smell
customer_reviews.text: Arrived fast, smelled rancid, my Cat and Dog would not approach and I had to throw them away. My Dog is not picky, so this was alarming. I have given my Pets Freeze Dried Chicken before and they loved it. I do not know if this was stored improperly but the Rancid smell was really bad. It did not expire until 2020 so more of it is out there, BEWARE. Received refund from Seller.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra D. Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: is my dog's favorite treat. I can give her other treats
customer_reviews.text: This product, without a doubt, is my dog's favorite treat. I can give her other treats, but these are the ones she picks out first. I also keep an eye on the pricing on this product as it fluctuates, so always try to pick a few up when the pricing is great. My photo of the dog with her nose in her food dish rooting out the treats isn't very becoming, so will just leave you with the type written visual! Oh, the other thing about these treats, is that I use these little buckets for so many other things afterwards and never throw them away. They are just the right size with the lid.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine H.

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but powder and bone/marrow
customer_reviews.text: Nearly every piece had large sections of bone and was rock hard. Storage conditions also resulted in nearly half a container of powder, mildew, and the remaining bits were so hard I couldn't break them up with my fingers. I even had a hard time slicing them up with a knife. Trying to cut up bone/marrow sent most pieces flying across the room. Storage conditions are one thing, but a product sold by weight that contains very little of the product you think you're buying, is a different matter. Cannot return, even with prime membership.
customer_reviews.author: Zaii

customer_reviews.title: My dogs favorite treat
customer_reviews.text: The chicken breast smells nothing like chicken to me, but it must smell fine to my dog because it's his favorite treat. It's also not a strong smell, which is nice because I keep them in a pocket when we're out ansld they don't make me smell like a giant dog treat by the time we're done. There was probably about a half inch of crumbs (ranging from basically powder to larger than rice sized slivers of various sizes) at the bottom of the container, but there was actually more good sized pieces than I was expecting and it didn't seem excessive amount of crumbs in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: LabRat

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed that I wasted more than $30 on these treats
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed that I wasted more than $30 on these treats. They were mostly powder and only about 1/4 to 1/3 treats I could pick up. I am ending up sprinkling the tiny bits on my dog's food. I left them for my dog sitter to use as treats while I was away. Had they not already opened and used them I would have returned it. Just no point. It's more like Freeze dried chicken liver dust than actual treats. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Bab

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love, cheap tip included
customer_reviews.text: Dogs love. Trick I learned on a video - stretch this stuff by powdering it (video used a coffee grinder, but put 'em in a sturdy baggie and use a hammer and presto). Then put a spoonful or two in a bag to coat any small treat or even kibble, adding smell and flavor. Presto - cheap training treats and a small tub of this will go a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia P.

customer_reviews.title: tasty but way too big, company doesn't care about suggestions
customer_reviews.text: As owner and head trainer of South Orlando Dog Training, these are wonderful tasty treats that won't go bad in my treat pouch. However, they are cut in 3/4" to 1" squares. This is way too big even for larger dogs. I literally have to take out the treats and cut them up into pea sized pieces in order to make them useful. I called the company to suggest that they make them smaller but I was met with distain and resistance. So I really can't recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Twc

customer_reviews.title: Dogs LOVE these treats
customer_reviews.text: I have used these treats to train and maintain two Golden Retrievers using the positive-reinforcement method currently popular with trainers. I find I can slice the cubes into four or six pieces with a pocket knife and still get excellent obedience without feeding too many calories. Our dogs love them, and they are easy to carry in a treat bag or plastic snack-size storage bag without making a greasy mess. Slicing the treats does leave some liver dust on the cutting surface, but it's easily wiped away.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Rabbit

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: First I want to point out how funny it is that I'm also asked to rate the freshness and flavor of the product, as if I ate it. I ordered the freeze dried liver for training purposes. I am disappointed. The pieces are not a nice uniform cube as shown in the picture. They are all sorts of (odd) shapes and sizes. Worst, at least a third of this is essentially liver dust. I have ended up just sprinkling it on their dog food rather than using the product for training as intended, and that's not an acceptable use of a $30 product, in my opinion. I will never order again.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy

customer_reviews.title: Crushed Into Dust
customer_reviews.text: These arrived crushed into dust and such small pieces that they weren't appropriate for a 41-pound dog, nor for a 100-pound dog. The pieces are too tiny. My dogs love the flavor and scent; the quality seems to be ok; (no bugs were in either of the two plastic tins which I purchased.) But they're crushed into dust and really tiny pieces and thusly they will not work for us. Too bad ... otherwise, it was a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Korr

customer_reviews.title: Package flaw?
customer_reviews.text: I saw that other reviews were unhappy with the quantity. I recently received my order to find, that yes it's half full. However as it says on the package it's 4oz. I weighed it and yes it's 4oz so you are getting what you pay for, maybe they should just package a little differently. The treats themselves a great, all 3 of my dogs lovee them
customer_reviews.author: T. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Doggie addiction
customer_reviews.text: My Goldendoodle and cockapoo have become obsessed with these treats. They will whine where they know the treats are on the counter, they'll steal things out of the trash to try to trade for them, they'll beg to go outside only to come straight back inside because they sometimes get a treat if they come in on the first try. We're having to hide the treats at night because they won't go to sleep if they think there's a chance they'll get one. It's tough living with 2 addicts.
customer_reviews.author: Abbie Lynn

customer_reviews.title: my picky german shepherd will eat these
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned in the headline, my German Shepherd Dog is a picky eater. She refuses the vast majority of store bought treats so we normally have to make our own. Thus, you can imagine my surprise when she picked these treats over her home dried chicken treats during her training class! We immediately went home and bought the exact same treats for training at home. These treats are a hit with every dog we've come across at the dog park! I've yet to see a dog refuse these treats so if you have a picky eater, definitely try this!
customer_reviews.author: ElizabethTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Horrible - Smells Rancid
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this product for a while now, but the last bucket I received smelled rancid. I asked for a replacement bucket and it was delivered quickly, but unfortunately has the same rancid smell and my dog will not eat it. I'm not sure what happened with this product or quality - but definitely do not buy! Nasty!! I would like a refund for the amount I originally paid - I can't use the product.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great product, superior quality.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my hermit crabs, my dogs love them more! These are wonderful because they do not get gummy or tacky with minimum exposure to humidity, nor do they stink. My hermit crabs love them, I do not have to buy raw meat at the store, and my dogs get a treat now and then . . . win, win, win. The only down side is the container lid does not stay on tight, so make sure you do not drop it after opening. My dogs got a lot of treats that night ;D
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Freeman

customer_reviews.title: It's a dog's version of steak!
customer_reviews.text: I've had dogs for more than fifty years and short of giving them a nice Porterhouse I've never seen my current three love anything like these! OK, it ain't the cheapest on the market but really - you want to go cheap on your best friend?? If you're lucky for ten or fifteen years he/she is your best buddy and protector - any dog deserves the very best you can give them. Would you seriously eat any of that processed stuff from of shore producers - then why would you feed it to your best friend? Do yourself a favor and part with the additional pennies - you'll sleep a lot better at night!
customer_reviews.author: Native Maine'ah

customer_reviews.title: Dogs give 4 paws up, but.....
customer_reviews.text: I've used these quite often and the dogs love them. However, I noticed that the last bucket I bought was mostly dust and small pieces of crumbs. I'm not sure if they are just trying to rip folks off or if it's an honest mistake or what. It's a shame either way because now I can't buy them anymore. I'll need to find a different treat to replace. Any suggestions for natural, healthy treats welcome.If I had the time to make my own treats I would start doing that again. Or I guess I'll just make the time.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon J.

customer_reviews.title: Widely varied sizes, including some crumbs
customer_reviews.text: This product was not a liver, but a freeze dried chicken breast meat. We had a wide swing of sizes, of the meat treats, within the tub. Some were very large (1.5" long by .; wide, more we 1 inch by 1/2 inch) and great for my large dogs, but some (probably 40-50% were medium to small). That means 1/2 long.... or less. We had maybe 3% crumbs, which I poured into food bowls.
customer_reviews.author: E. Amos

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs LOVE THESE!
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs, an older dog that will eat anything and a younger dog that is more picky and cautious. These treats are loved by both. I can use these treats for training my younger dog because although she's not really a food driven dog, she loves these treats. I feel good about them because they are liver. Just liver. Originally was a little put off by the odd size of the snack, but I recognized that because it wasn't a manmade product the size would probably differ as it was probably sliced then freeze dried. Some of th pieces are on the large size, like maybe a 1/2 inch, but that didn't bother either of my dogs.
customer_reviews.author: NJMom

customer_reviews.title: Great treats to keep your puppies healthy and happy!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried Stewart's freeze dried raw dog food and my Doxie loved it. It helped him tremendously with ear/skin allergies, and his coat turned puppy fur soft. Of course when I ran out he started having issues again. So I tried Stewart Freeze Dried Treats (Beef liver) and he loves them too! And again his fur started to shine again. Stewart's treat are also priced really well for the quality. Thanks Stewart's for helping my Doxie stay healthy and happy!
customer_reviews.author: A Customer

customer_reviews.title: Half the bucket was just dust!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to find these. My vet uses the freeze dried livers and recommend I use them at home. Since they only sell in huge bulk I was excited to find some. BUT!! Half of the bucket was dust or tiny tiny pieces that are too small even for my smallest dog. I’m so disappointed:( they would be amazing if not for this. Such a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Mom24

customer_reviews.title: The smellThe smell is horrible
customer_reviews.text: This is not the same as the Stewart’s that I buy in the pet store it had a foul smell and it made my dog sick I had to throw it away it’s just not the right thing I do not recommend this to anybody
customer_reviews.author: Linda Marcelli

customer_reviews.title: My dog's love Stewart Freeze dried liver treats!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these Stewart Freeze dried liver treats for many many years. I used to buy from pets mart half the time they wouldn't have in stock. Thank goodness for Amazon I signed up for subscribe and save now we receive every month. Our boxador goes crazy for Stewart liver treats and forgets to chew so I cut them up with kitchen scissors to make them last longer. I take the liver shavings and liver remains in bottom of bucket pour over their kibbies they woof em down. I've given as gifts many times! This was my 10th purchase just from Amazon. I wash out the buckets and save they come in handy for painting.
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money. 4 different dogs wouldn’t touch it
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to train my puppy. First time I tried giving it to him, one sniff, then wouldn’t touch it. I thought maybe it was an ‘acquired taste.’ So over the next month, I tried introducing it in his food and as a treat. Still wouldn’t touch it. Tried to return it. Amazon won’t take it after a month. Tried to give it away to 3 different friends. Their dogs wouldn’t touch it either. I even tried contacting the Stewart, the manufacturer, thinking maybe the “Guaranteed” on the package meant something. No response.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable price, biggest size I've found
customer_reviews.text: Doggie crack. I had Shelties that would do anything for this freeze dried liver. My parents have a sweet, but extremely finicky Rat Terrier. While she isn't addicted like my Shelties used to be, sprinkling the "dust" from the bottom of the container over her dry kibble makes her eat it up. Depending on your dog's appetite, this container could last a year. Be sure to have plenty of water available because the Ratty licks her chops afterward like it sticks on her teeth and maybe leaves her mouth dry.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Great, ingredient friendly treat for your dog!
customer_reviews.text: Boy oh boy does my pup love these treats! He now turns his nose to his biscuit treats he used to love so much. We got the large tub of turkey liver, and I’m glad we went with the larger tub because we seem to be going through these quickly. Only complaint is that about 15% of the tub is small crumb like pieces that won’t make good treats. Besides that I am very excited about this treat only having one ingredient! Makes me feel better about giving them to my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlynn B

customer_reviews.title: The absolutely best treat for my dogs. They absolutely love them!
customer_reviews.text: We been using these for a while at the recommendation of our vet. We have two dogs and they will absolutely do anything for these treats. I also really like that there's only one ingredient. We cut them up to smaller pieces if they're too big and they cut very easily. Our smallest is a rescue Terrier and we will sometimes cut them up in very small pieces and sprinkle it on his breakfast to get them to eat. I highly recommend the streets to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hare

customer_reviews.title: My dogs prefer these over many others
customer_reviews.text: We have a rescued daschund mix that is rather picky but we also recently adopted 2 beagle pups. This treat seems to tickle all three dogs in the right place because they actually listen when these come out. We've tried several different treats and brands but this seems to work the best for training the beagle pups. And it doesn't hurt that our daschund loves them too. The price is great too. The only thing is the chunks are rather big and I need to use a hammer to break them apart into small pieces which makes a powdery mess in the process.
customer_reviews.author: James K

customer_reviews.title: Puppy loves them
customer_reviews.text: Training a dog that has almost no food drive is a pain in the butt. Seriously, the dog couldn’t care less about almost any treat I put in front of him. Until I tried freeze dried liver treats. Oh man. He goes nuts. Suddenly, he listens to every command and won’t take his eyes off the treat. I agree with another reviewer that these are a little too big to use as training treats so I cut all of them into 3 or 4 pieces. Yeah, it took a little while but it really makes them last. Highly recommend these treats!
customer_reviews.author: CharlestonGirl

customer_reviews.title: Too many broken pieces
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews from other customers that there were just to many broken pieces in big tub. But I thought maybe it was just a bad batch, as I have purchased these in stores in the past. Nope, after you get just 1/2 way through tub, it went from The regular small bite size training pieces to very small pieces and crumbs, to small to use. I ended up mixing it with soft food. But these are not cheap, so until they improve in this problem, I will not be buying from this company again. I really dislike writing bad reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer AB

customer_reviews.title: My puppers love these! They will do almost any trick
customer_reviews.text: My puppers love these! They will do almost any trick, (that they know) just to get one little cube. These are great. They have a little odor when the lid is open, but its not bad, and disappears quickly when the lid is closed. At the end of the container, I sprinkle the little bit of powder from settling on their food, and they are so happy. This is a must try for your dog. It is just liver without any other additives, like corn or other substitutes. Its a natural product for your pup that they will love.
customer_reviews.author: M. Champion

customer_reviews.title: Dogs Love Them
customer_reviews.text: My dogs go nuts for these treats. As someone who doesn't eat a lot of meat, I find the idea of handling liver and chicken a little gross, but since they're freeze dried it doesn't smell or feel terrible and both of my dogs absolutely love these. It's nice not to have smelly, greasy hands after touching these. We save them as special treats for training since they're so high value. There are a lot of really tiny bits in the jar, but I use that as a food topper since my dogs are super picky and often won't eat plain dog food.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: DOGS LOVE THEM!!
customer_reviews.text: I always gave this product a 5 star but last batch was mostly crumbled pieces!!! Never happened before. Giving one more chance. Hope New order the pieces are WHOLE. others have complained of this.
customer_reviews.author: theresa

customer_reviews.title: Makes my dog sick
customer_reviews.text: I tried to use this brand years ago but noticed my dogs getting sick from it. Switched to another brand and the stomach issues went away. Last month my normal brand was sold out so I bought a tub of this hopeful that it didn't have the same problems as before. Nope, now I have sick dogs. Not a coincidence, something is up with this brand of treats. Stomach issues goes away in a day or two of last treat given.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewman

customer_reviews.title: an excellent training incentive for furkids
customer_reviews.text: These freeze-dried all beef liver treats for doggers are really a great & effective motivator for my dogs for training as well as just for "atta boys." They are referred to as "high value treats" by several professional trainers I have had work with my dogs. They are not cheap by any means, but I often buy them rather than less expensive "training incentives" for my furkids. All of my dogs have loved them, even more than other types/brands of treats. Furthermore, they do not contain any ingredients that could be less than healthy for your doggers. If in doubt, however, always check with your vet before giving your furkid(s) any new treat.
customer_reviews.author: an honest review

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect a bucket of treats for a large dog.
customer_reviews.text: The salmon looks all right as dried salmon might, and it smells like salmon as does the dog’s breath. I am disappointed as at least 2/3rds of the tub are tiny pieces that may work for a miniature dog but are useless as a treat for our Labrador Retriever. I am adding some to her meals; however, I was looking for healthy training rewards. I don’t know about ‘longevity’ although they are useable after 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon L

customer_reviews.title: Veterinarian's dream to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: Really seem to win over my toughest customers (I'm a vet), the cost really adds up and the prices for the different sizes is very inconsistent so I can never just reorder the same size bucket each time. Regardless, they are always high quality and fresh and have had many clients exclaim that "Their dog is incredibly picky about treats and NEVER eats any". I have a lot of dogs that will allow vaccines and nail trims gladly too busy to notice while chomping on these.
customer_reviews.author: J. BushTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: ONE ingredient dog treats!!
customer_reviews.text: BEST dog treats ever!! We have a dog who seems to be allergic to certain foods and he loves these! Besides having to consider his allergies for when we buy dog treats, we also don’t want to fill him with preservatives and other cancer calling stuff that you usually find in generic dog treats from the super market. This tub lasts us a long while (we cut the pieces in half since they’re pretty big) and it doesn’t break the bank. We really love the idea that the only ingredient is the liver because we know exactly what we are feeding our dogs and they go bananas for them so they’re great at training treats too! Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jse

customer_reviews.title: Popular among all dogs
customer_reviews.text: Love this versatile freeze-dried product. I use it as a treat (break into small pieces for the small dog, larger pieces for the larger dog buddies), or break it into powder / small chunks as kibble topper. My Chipoo loves it both ways. This is definitely a high value treat. Smell is strong enough it is also great for scent training (yeah I still have hopes that she will learn to at least sniff out the rats). We've had the bucket for months; keep it in the kitchen through very hot weather. It has retained its freshness (and dryness). Highly recommend. We bought again.
customer_reviews.author: Constant Reader

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the value
customer_reviews.text: Our dog was started on a daily antibiotic that we had to mix in with her food, but she didn't like the taste. We then started putting liver treats in her food to get her to eat. We decided to purchase this item because we had seen it on our vet's shelf. We had previously been buying liver treats at the pet store, however the amount you get vs the cost was a little difficult to swallow. Especially since we mix it into our dogs food every time we feed her. Stuart freeze dried treats made it possible for us to continue our dogs daily regime.
customer_reviews.author: TexasRose303

customer_reviews.title: Great for Cats too!
customer_reviews.text: Pricier than I would like but it is a consistent hit with my cat. He mostly eats wet food only. He will only litely graze on dry throughout the day. Because canned wet food has far less protein content than dry, I decided to start mixing in freeze-dried protein to his wet-food, and this particular product from Stewart forms the bulk of what I use. I am certain this move towards mixing in freeze-dried protein has contributed to him gaining a bit more weight/muscle (which is what I wanted as he is a little on the runty side), aaaand it has made his poos a lot less stinky and runny. They now always come out fairly dry and cylindrical! Win!
customer_reviews.author: plastic dervish

customer_reviews.title: A repeat purchase
customer_reviews.text: I might have gotten this from another supplier before, but I know I have gotten this product before. Only a few things to mention; The pieces are on the larger size, so at least for my dog (about 24 pounds) I need to cut the larger pieces in half. Due to the rich nature of the product (liver is a rich snack for dogs), I limit him to 1 or 2 pieces per day. Other than that, he loves these things, and I feel much better giving him these than any of those super processed, mass marketed treats that look and smell horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Nub

customer_reviews.title: Yessss!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest size tub I have found, happy surprise! It was totally full and the pieces seem a bit larger than the other tubs I bought. I saw some reviews with quality issues; I am happy I had no such issues buying on here or in stores. If you want to make your sweet honory 10 yrd pup do whatever you ask? Buy these!! We are big fans and this is a steal of a deal, no more in store buys! Plus shipping was crazy extra fast, last thing I ordered, first to arrive! High quality product, my pup has a sensitive stomach and has gotten treat picky and these are by far her favorite with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: jennm

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves them, which is the whole point, right?
customer_reviews.text: My GSD doesn't care for most treats. She'll gently take it out of your hand, turn away, and place it on the ground to ignore it. She doesn't like peanut butter either, but she loves these. She gets really excited when I even glance at the container. There are some good chunks in there for "big" rewards, and there are lots of "slivers" too, which are good for simple training session rewards. Tally in my house Loves these: My GSD, my foster GSD Is fine with these: My foster husky Doesn't care at all: Both our cats, MIL's rat terrier TL;DR get these for your GSD or other working-breed dog.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Beware of smart dogs stealing treats! :)
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sure this picture says it all. All 3 of my dogs love the beef and turkey liver treats. This is my red heeler stealing the entire tub of turkey liver treats from the pantry... When one treat just isn't enough, take the whole thing, and cross your paws thay Mom doesn't notice! :)
customer_reviews.author: Kate Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Quality has decreased.
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these treats for 2 years. They are expensive, but I (in the past) loved the nice square chunks to give the dog, The last bucket I purchased in December, is about 1/4 crumbs and little pieces. Not at all satisfied with this bucket. After reading so many reviews I am not sure I will buy again. I put this as 2 stars as it seems like the quality is decreasing. I might give it one more try, but will return if the next bucket is as bad as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Miki Kraai

customer_reviews.title: WAY too big + mostly empty
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before buying so I wasn't too shocked when the bin came mostly empty (I mean, why even have this sized tub if you're not gonna fill it) but actually the 3stars is for the size of the treats. The directions say feed up to 1 - 2 to the dog....uh, why? Because they're HUGE! I find that I can cut it into a 3x3x3 (27 pc) or at least 3x3x2 (18 pc) and they last a long time as training treats. I think they smell fine but my husband hates the liver smell so we precut a bunch and put them in a ziplock treat bag and store the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Size inconsistency, but still perfection!!
customer_reviews.text: My one year old Australian Shepherd loves these treats, they work well for distracting her when she needs to calm down. The only unexpected aspect in these treats is their inconsistent size. Some treats can be sized up to 2”x2” cubes, they are all natural so I should have expected that there would be size differences. I cut the big ones in half or into quarters with scissors, they didn’t crumble too much. There is also a statement on the back of the packaging with a size disclaimer, basically saying that there is no guarantee to any specific size or shape. Overall this treat is one of the highest reward treats that my dog has. She loves them so much!!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these
customer_reviews.text: These are my go to treats for my Boston Terrier. I love that they are made in the U.S. and I can trust they are good for my dog. They are a tiny bit stinky but I store them in an air tight container. Totally worth the price to know that the quality is good. There are so many questionable dog treats out there. These are my favorites.
customer_reviews.author: Audio file devouress

customer_reviews.title: My four finicky pups love them!
customer_reviews.text: My finicky pups love this product! I bought the smaller size first not knowing whether or not they would even try them! Now they beg for them. They have eaten the Stewart’s dried beef liver for years and now love the turkey just as much. I never worry about quality with this brand .
customer_reviews.author: Debster

customer_reviews.title: Our Cat Does NOT Like This Salmon Treat
customer_reviews.text: Until recently when it was discontinued on Amazon, we bought WildSide Salmon Treats for Dogs for years. When our Subscribe and Save order said that product was discontinued and recommended The Original Freeze Dried Treat Stewart 100% Pure Salmon we figured it would be the same. It is NOT! Every piece has skin on it. It is not anywhere near the quality we were used to with WildSide. And, the proverbial bottom line, where the rubber meets the road, is our cat will not eat it. Nyet! No!! Nada!!! We won't be buying this again.
customer_reviews.author: Joyful Living

customer_reviews.title: Dog won't eat these now - something has changed:
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these for my dog for many years. He previously loved them and would practically do back flips for one of these treats. Since my recent purchase of a container of these, he will put it in his mouth, spit it out and walk away. What's changed? Even if the color of them seems changed and they just don't look like the ones I have previously purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Gates

customer_reviews.title: Great for cat treats and food supplement, IF YOU HAVE A PICKY CAT THIS WILL MAKE THEM LOVE ANY FOOD!
customer_reviews.text: order this for our cat who was a picky eater, she would like one brand for as meal or two and then not want to eat any of her wet food, would switch brands and shed another meal or two, well we ordered this as kinda a treat for her and to train her with, but figured we'd sprinkle some on her wet food and now it's a go-to for her meals and she finishes every bowl of wet food we give her now. great product. personally have not tried the product ourselves but from the noises our cat makes id say its probably great.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Stewart's Chicken Liver Treats - Crumbles
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, my first sample order of the Chicken Liver Treats was quite a disappointment. They were received mostly in little crumples, some more like grains of sand. About 1/3 was in normal size clumps, but the rest were just crumbles. Stewart's Beef Liver Treats were received in the same shipment, and were in fine shape. One expects some product breakup, but the Chicken Liver Treats... far too much for me to re-order. Picture attached with the BEST of the order sitting on top of the pile.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: GREAT “HEALTHY” EVERYDAY TREAT YOU CAN FEEL GOOD ABOUT!!
customer_reviews.text: My dog LOVES these treats (he’s pretty picky- only likes meaty treats, doesn’t like fruit and vegetable treats like sweet potato or blueberry, etc.). He also appears to be allergic to some products with chicken in them. Unlike other “over-processed” and sugary or artificially flavored treats, these are 100% dried beef liver/only one ingredient. I feel great giving him a few of these every day! They digest well, he loves them, they’re the perfect size for a small dog, and my vet totally approves! 100% recommend. This is the only treat I buy!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Canine “Crack”
customer_reviews.text: This is a great price for the the number of treats you get. And the dogs go nuts for them. I can make them to anything for just one of them. The price is better at Amazon than at a chain brick-and-mortar pet store, and it’s about 12 ounces smaller to boot. Great deal. Tried to make my own liver treats, which the dogs loved. However, it stunk up my house for a few days and the treats go bad if you don’t freeze them or use them immediately. I’d rather buy these than go through the hassle of making them.
customer_reviews.author: TXChainsawKiller

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THESE
customer_reviews.text: My dogs go CRAZY for these. They're sooooo fresh. My papillon is tiny at 6 pounds so these are too big for her little mouth but with kitchen scissors they're super easy to just snip up into small pieces. I also give them to my diabetic pomeranian and she loves them as well. There are very few snacks she can have but these are super basic and just turkey so she can have these. Also the value for your money is huge. There are other smaller bags of these out there for much higher price. But these are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality treat
customer_reviews.text: My dog definitely prefers what I refer to as "Animal Part Treats" as opposed to baked flour-type treats/biscuits. Fortunately she is so small (14 lbs) that it is not an expensive option really. Plus I have to watch what she eats and factor that into the amount and nutrition she is getting each day- so these really are a win-win and are better for her than baked biscuits.
customer_reviews.author: LifeWithRenTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I cant say for taste as I do not eat these but my dogs love them but dogs eat cat poop so who can say their tastebuds are accurate? Anyway this is a great value, the tub was almost full, not half full like some reviews show. I was nervous that I would get a half full tub but luckily its pretty full. The chunks are big so its not really training size but the large chunks are perfect size for my dogs since I use these with their homemade dog food so they get the organ meat dogs need. I wish this company also offered hearts.
customer_reviews.author: Jarbells

customer_reviews.title: These are great treats for stuffing in a Kong
customer_reviews.text: I was using Trader Joe's freeze dried liver treats, but they stopped carrying them. This tub is enormous and will last a long time with two Yorkie puppies. They love it when I stuff them into a Kong. It takes them half the morning to get it out. I do cut them into smaller pieces. If you do so, realize they are a little crumbly.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Laughlin

customer_reviews.title: ALWAYS ALWAYS ALWAYS buy this ANIMAL LOVERS
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE. Yes I am that guy who tries everything I feed my dogs. When my pup became paralyzed we went to 1st pet in Mesa AZ. They had these treats and the treats never made my pup sick or made his stool soft. All my dogs love them and from the video I tried a bite and was impressed how good it was. Its simple.... Freeze dried chicken..... nothing else. Price is reasonable. just a piece of advice buy two tubs. During shipping the pieces get broken up more and there is powder at the bottom. Still can use that to sprinkle on their food, but ran out before I could buy more. AWESOME, EXCELLENT, ate them myself.
customer_reviews.author: John Keith

customer_reviews.title: Mostly waxy fat, only about half is chicken meat
customer_reviews.text: This used to be my cat's favorite treat. So I had it on Subscribe and Save for quite a while. But the recent delivery had a lot of fat which, no surprise, was waxy not crunchy. My cat could tell by scent when I would give him one with fat. He would smack it off my fingers and complain (translate "don't give me that crap!") . When I examined the ones he did not want, sure enough - waxy fat Good thing he can tell the good from the bad or I would have a very sick cat now!
customer_reviews.author: Mais

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: What's happening to the quality of freeze dried chicken? I've been a returning customer and buying a tub at least once every month, but the quality has declined significantly. The recent tubs that I've been getting have overly dried chicken, and they are very hard to break. It doesn't even look white anymore, and they look burnt!! My dog coughed several times because the pieces are too hard for her. I would not recommend this product to my family and friends anymore!!!
customer_reviews.author: Megan H

customer_reviews.title: Great Training Treats
customer_reviews.text: I've tried pretty much all of the varieties and recommend them completely! Freeze dried meat by products, no preservatives, no additives, just meat. My pooch loves them and I have no guilt in giving them to him as I know what he is getting is healthy. When he gets finicky in his eating I sprinkle the smaller bits over his food and he dives right in. Price goes down dramatically for larger sizes, so I usually have the 16.8 ounce buckets of Turkey, Chicken and Beef on hand so I can vary his treats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are NOT training treats
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because it said they were training treats, but since each piece is 1 inch cubes or larger I have to cut them down to training treat size, which is tedious. Also my bucket was only 1/2 full and felt very light compared to the bags of dehydrated beef liver I’ve gotten in the past. I should have weighed the product as I doubt it was at the correct weight. If you’re looking for training treats look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Cateyeclover

customer_reviews.title: Don’t overfeed
customer_reviews.text: My dog is obsessed with these. It’s the running joke of our dog training class that I take her to cus she’s a ****** menace with me, but for her trainer, who feeds her these, she’s doing tricks I have never even heard of. Only 1/4 of the dogs in class don’t go crazy for these. Good amount for the price! Huge container (14oz) Have to pay attention to the feeding guidelines though, as small dogs shouldn’t have too many.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda7365

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves these.
customer_reviews.text: Since they are dried liver treats .....they don't smell like roses. It doesn't bother me that the pieces are a different size . My Weimaraner loves them and they are like a special treat and if they are too big then I break them or even cut them....not a problem. I am happy with these and if my dog is happy then this momma is happy. Will definitely buy again. As far as freshness, they are as far as I can tell. Since they are dried I really don't think about it.
customer_reviews.author: NAL

customer_reviews.title: What happened?
customer_reviews.text: Just like other recent reviews I questioned why I got less product for a higher price. At first I thought it was just settlement but no. Plus, my dogs absolutely love these and BEG for more. This last shipment was different. Both of my dogs left the treats on the floor. I canceled my auto subscription and will buy thru Chewy. I can't trust the ones on Amazon anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Heather V

customer_reviews.title: Bindi's favorite treat
customer_reviews.text: I love how easy this purchase is to cut in to small pieces, she always had a few pieces added to her dry Dog food. I am especially impressed with the quality of my most recent purchase thru Amazon in the container size of 21oz it is perfect, I have purchased a few12 oz size at a pet store and every piece had dried paper attached it and the pieces were so small I ended up throwing them away. I will only buy this size again and from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Heitzig

customer_reviews.title: My boy loves this treat
customer_reviews.text: I love that I can give my boy big chucks of liver that is very healthy for him - freeze dried and no preservatives. Of course, the smaller pieces eventually end up as toppers. I pour all of it into the best container I have found called "Airscape Coffee and Food Storage Canister - Patented Airtight Lid Preserve Food Freshness with Two Way CO2 Valve" which pushes all of the air out of the canister. I have the silver one. My boy is worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Skyway Shoppers

customer_reviews.title: Healthy, tasty, excellent treats
customer_reviews.text: These freeze dried treats are the best. NOT messy, don't need to be refrigerated, healthy, quality. Dog loves them. 5 stars. Note that there is a shelf life, I had stockpiled up multiple buckets. The last one (beef liver, not these chicken ones) was approx 1-1/2 years old and had developed moths in it. Not an issue, simply put it in the freezer for a bit to kill the moths/mealyworms. But be aware that there is a shelf life, as with all foods: it is not unlimited. 5 stars all the way.
customer_reviews.author: W. Coe

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this in the past but this last tub of treats was a Disaster! When I opened the container it was just ground up liver powder. Ended up just mixing into the food. Very poor quality comtrol.
customer_reviews.author: kaw

customer_reviews.title: Good as rehydrated mixture with kibble
customer_reviews.text: This is good stuff. I use a blender and about 4 other types of freeze dried foods & supplements and rehydrate it all and place it in the fridge to use for 3 days. It blends well and rehydrate well. It is a good stepping stone to moving to a real raw diet. It's in pretty large (inch by 2 inch ish) blocks and crumble when cut (for those wanting to feed as treats). Also, be aware that freeze dried and dehydrate foods dehydrate your dog unless rehydrated for at least a day.
customer_reviews.author: Bambi SloanTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Tiny broken fragments, and not much product
customer_reviews.text: Except for the top layer, most of the pieces were tiny or even pulverized, and the amount of product was little compared with the size of the container (see photo). My dog liked them, but then again, he eats poop.
customer_reviews.author: Zen

customer_reviews.title: Just okay.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the chicken liver. There are some larger pieces but also many small to tiny pieces. If I had given it more through I would have went with beef liver or something that’s not small to start with so I would hopefully get larger pieces. I will sprinkle left over pieces on my dog’s food. He loves it. I’m not sure if I will reorder. The price is right but I’m not very happy about all the tiny pieces. See the attached picture. I just don’t like that there’s so much of it in tiny pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Cowboy’s wife

customer_reviews.title: Louie and Leila give these 30 stars
customer_reviews.text: I tried to explain that 5 was the maximum, but they insisted. I think this is our fourth purchase. Had no problems with too many crumbs or small chunks, no off-smells or anything like that. If anything, the pieces are often a little too big, and difficult to cut into smaller pieces. Two 80-pound dogs, we give them 4-5 pieces each, nightly, and a container lasts about 3 weeks. The remaining little bits are sprinkled on their kibble.
customer_reviews.author: T. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the packaging!
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed when this order came. The container was slightly open so a significant amount of treats had fallen out into the box. Because the box came while I was at work and the treats were floating around in the box ants had completely infiltrated the package by the time I got home. The treats themselves are great. I get them for my dog who is on a strict lowfat diet due to pancreatitis, however, this was my first time ordering them online and it was a complete nightmare.
customer_reviews.author: Allie Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Good for your dog 2
customer_reviews.text: This is the one dog treat that is: 1. Good for your dog 2. Made in USA 3. Totally safe 4. A treat your dog won't turn down. 4. Has long shelf life 5. No additives, dyes, fillers - only one ingredient. My dogs are picky, but really they know what is good for them. They consistently turn down "dog cookies" made out of some baked product. But they love love love these treats. They are excellent nutrition so I don't hesitate to give them to them and don't worry about "bad treats." These treats are the best.
customer_reviews.author: S. Shea

customer_reviews.title: OK occasionally
customer_reviews.text: Had a batch that made my dog sick. They replaced it for free no questions asked, but too rich for an every day treat. Started using it because it was recommended by our vet who still uses it in the clinic as a treat. We have switched to making homemade treats and meals which is not a solution every one has time to do. I still would recommend this as an occasional treat. Also, it is recommended that you wash your hands after each use.
customer_reviews.author: TheNose

customer_reviews.title: Cat and dog agree! 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Yes, a treat for both. I opened the container to nice big, dog sized chunks and smaller kitty flakes. To make her meal special, I grind some to sprinkle on the cat's breakfast bowl of kibble and a few bites of hard boiled egg. What can I say, I'm a sucker for a big pair of yellow eyes surrounded by black fur. The dog gets hers as a reward for good behavior and learning stuff. "Let me do that thing again, Mom, I like what I'm paid for it."
customer_reviews.author: Janee Jarrell

customer_reviews.title: My Dogs Love These
customer_reviews.text: These are my dogs' favorite treat. I love the fact that they are all beef liver and don't have filler, sugar, or additives in them. I used to get some similar treats at Trader Joes, and they discontinued them and now have treats with sugar. The liver squares are pretty large, so I cut them in half for my smaller dogs (and sometimes even smaller). They are a good price when you consider the price per ounce compared similar dehydrated meat treats.
customer_reviews.author: bic

customer_reviews.title: Dog canabis
customer_reviews.text: Most favored of all treats. Not sure why by the looks or smell, but I call these "fancy treats" and they totally trump Pupperoni to get the dog to come in when he doesn't want to. I say "fancy treats" at the door and have to step aside to avoid being bowled over at the door. Not good in the pocket as a field treat, but the container seals tight (with some fiddling) and he is totally enthiused about every morsel.
customer_reviews.author: good or not

customer_reviews.title: Too much protein in it
customer_reviews.text: Be VERY CAREFUL how much you give your pets, most pets can’t handle 100 % protein! I found out the hard way and I nearly lost my dog, come to find out she has liver failure
customer_reviews.author: 6PkOfMalt’s

customer_reviews.title: Quality has declined while price went up too high
customer_reviews.text: I started using these a few years ago. My pups love them... I now only have my 5 lb Yorkie left so I break them into small pieces. The problem is that the last few times I got them, about half of the container was unusable. The pieces are thin wafers - like REALLY thin.... too small for even my Yorkie to eat. Plus the price went up more than $10! What used to be a reasonable treat for my dog now seems to be a waste fo money
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: !00% protein
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this and I am happy to give him something that is good for him. I share it with my neighbors dogs. One dog is a rescue and never took a cookie from my hand or ate any cookie in my presence. He took the liver treat directly from my hand. I think we became better friends. I have been sharing with all my friends who have dogs, 100% love this treat. I was also pleasantly surprised by the size. It will last a while.
customer_reviews.author: C. B.

customer_reviews.title: Great treat and source of protein
customer_reviews.text: My dogs and cats love this treat more than any other one. I use it as a reward and if one of my animals are not wanting to eat their dry food, I grate it on top and they gobble their food up. It is a great source of extra protein. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the container has changed in recent years. It is very difficult to get the lid off when I first open it. I like the old container because I reused it in the past and this one doesn't work for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Finchbird

customer_reviews.title: Now I See Why That These Treats Were Going For $10.19!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased 2 of the 16.8 oz freeze dried treats for my dog and when I opened one of the two buckets, the majority of it was full of shake and crumbs! I placed it under the light and it was barely half full. As for the other one, it was roughly 3/4 full but I haven't opened it yet. I thought that I was getting a great deal on these treats because at PetsSmart/Petco, they sell anywhere between $25-$30......boy was I surprised, but the "silver lining" to this was that I didn't pay the regular price for them........"Whew!!"
customer_reviews.author: Andre Lamont Johnson

customer_reviews.title: BIG Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in Amazon box. Treats unsealed. Top loose and does not even fit well to close properly. Looks like 1/2 treats missing. Will NOT buy this brand again although I wanted to buy domestic. They also do not look like the ones my vet has. She told me to purchase on Amazon. Seeking another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Bj

customer_reviews.title: MY DOG LOVES THESE...and she’s very picky!
customer_reviews.text: I tried samples of these when I was in the pet store recently and my little rescue dog loved them! And she is one of the pickiest eaters I’ve ever seen. I’m so thrilled to have found treats that are good for her that she likes. Great quality. 100% beef liver and very reasonably priced. My store only carries the large tub size and it’s well over $30. So I order the smaller sizes on amazon. They stay fresher this way as well. My fur baby is very happy!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Chicken "Dust"
customer_reviews.text: We've purchased these 4 times, beef and chicken, bc our vet gives them as treats after shots, etc. Her's are always cubes, and I never notice an odor. Ours?? Yeah, DUST. Dust and some slivers that disintegrate when you touch them. There may be as many as 10 whole cubes in the large tub. And they stink to high heaven. So, she says she gets hers locally, and if I decide to give them one last try, I'll buy mine locally....maybe the ones we get from Amazon have simply sat too long in a warehouse. Our dogs love the whole ones, so I'll give 2 stars.
customer_reviews.author: voracious reader

customer_reviews.title: Dogs love them!
customer_reviews.text: Our two mini schnauzers love these. We also buy the liver treats and they get super excited about both. My only complaint is the size. They are chopped too small and tend to crumble into dust. There is a lot of extra space in the container and during shipment product is bounced around so much it naturally happens. Would be great if the manufacturing chopped 3x larger. The important thing is the 4-leggeds are happy!
customer_reviews.author: Mona O

customer_reviews.title: Why such a huge tub?
customer_reviews.text: The tub is barely filled 2/3 so not sure why it is soooo big! Treats are of uneven sizes, so it is good (depending on how much reward you are looking for) and bad (have to pick and choose). The smell can be quite overpowering in my opinion, and I am one to eat just about everything including, yes, liver. My dog loves those treats though. You can only feed 2-3 per day, so that tub will last you forever, if you can find room in your cabinets to store it.
customer_reviews.author: Laurence L.

customer_reviews.title: Gave my dog diarrhea horrible chemical smell
customer_reviews.text: POISON FOR YOUR PETS SMELLS OF CHEMICALS FEELS LIKE SPONGE PUT IN WATER ABSORBS LIKE A SPONGE TOO!! I ONLY HAD ONE DOG EAT IT SHE GOT DIARRHEA HAD TO GIVE HER IMODIUM TO STOP HER DIARRHEA. Mind you I have 6 dogs only 1 tried it and she got significant diarrhea that I had to give her Imodium to slow it down until she got that crap out of her system. That was only 2 small pieces. So much for human grade??? Don’t waste your money to poison your dog!!! Then kicker is they will not take their poison back!
customer_reviews.author: Doris Boone

product_meta.title: Stewart Freeze Dried Treats
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Beef Liver| Size:21 oz.Treat with Confidence We are the original freeze dried treat. When it comes to treats, we know that peace of mind is important. Rest assured that our quality standards with USDA-certified ingredients ensure that you're feeding safe dog treats. Thoughtfully Sourced and Made in the USA Our treats are locally sourced and manufactured in the heart of the Midwest under our own roof, to use with confidence under yours. Our promise to you is love and excitement in every bite. “My dogs go crazy for these beef liver treats! And I feel good knowing I’m giving them pure nutrition. ” - Sean M. Stewart Pro-Treat beef liver treats for dogs are an all-natural healthy dog treat that contains only USDA Grade A beef liver. That means they are gluten free, grain free, additive free and packed full of lean protein and nutrition. “These treat tubs last a long time and are a good value. ” - Rob P. Best Treat for Training Dogs love these crazy-delicious treats, which makes them excellent for training. In fact, Stewart freeze dried beef liver treats for dogs have been the top choice of professional trainers for over 40 years. “I’ve never met a dog that does not love these treats. They are perfect for training and rewards. ” - Frannie H. Choose Stewart Liver Treats for Dogs ● Preferred treat of pro trainers, vets, groomers and breeders ● Single ingredient, 100% pure beef liver ● All natural, nothing added ● Made in the USA ● Mouth-wateringly delicious Pet owners give Stewart “a round of appaws” for providing their best friends with balanced and delicious nutrition. Unleash nutrition and joy!
feature_bullets: Preferred choice of trainers for over 30 years

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
